block.p: Rabbi Julie Schonfeld and Aytan Y. Bellin, a lawyer, are to be married today in New Haven. Rabbi William Lebeau, a vice chancellor of the Jewish Theological Seminary of America, is to perform the ceremony at the Joseph R. Slifka Center for Jewish Life at Yale University.

Rabbi Schonfeld, 35, will keep her name. She is the rabbi at the Society for the Advancement of Judaism, a Reconstructionist and Conservative Synagogue in Manhattan. She graduated from Yale and received a master's degree in Judaic studies from the Jewish Theological Seminary, where she was ordained. She is a daughter of Trudy and Arnold Schonfeld, of Riverdale, the Bronx. Her father is a commercial real estate broker with Murray Hill Properties in Manhattan.

Mr. Bellin, also 35, is the counsel in Manhattan to the New York State Task Force on Life and the Law, which develops and recommends policies on issues arising from medical advances. He graduated from Yale and Columbia Law School. He is a son of Talah Bellin of Brooklyn and the late Dr. Lowell Eliezer Bellin. His mother is an assistant clinical dean and an assistant professor of preventive medicine at the State University Health Science Center at Brooklyn. His father, who was the New York City health commissioner from 1974 to 1977, retired as a professor of public health at Columbia's School of Public Health in Manhattan.
The bride and bridegroom, who graduated from Yale in 1987, did not meet until nearly a decade later, when a mutual friend from college introduced them.
